body: @mjsax is there any test failing that we can use to check if this works as expected? Thanks.

Refer to this link for build results (access rights to CI server needed): 
https://builds.apache.org/job/kafka-pr-jdk7-scala2.10/2446/
Test FAILed (JDK 7 and Scala 2.10).

I don't have a terribly strong opinion on this.

Scala setters always feel like a surprise and can easily go unnoticed when viewing other parts of code such as ReplicaStateMachine. I thought converting the setter to a function would emphasize that something unexpected is happening here (changing two pieces of state based on this one input).

This PR is a follow-up on an offline conversation I had with @dguy.

Once the Jenkins build is passing, it would be great to run the system tests via the branch builder.

There was one known transient failure in the system tests run:

```text
test_id:    kafkatest.tests.core.zookeeper_security_upgrade_test.ZooKeeperSecurityUpgradeTest.test_zk_security_upgrade.security_protocol=SSL
status:     FAIL
run time:   3 minutes 33.395 seconds


    Expected producer to still be producing.
```
I actually posted a PR to temporarily disable that test yesterday:
https://github.com/apache/kafka/pull/2742

@junrao @becketqin All integration tests have passed except `org.apache.kafka.connect.runtime.WorkerTest.testAddRemoveTask` with Scala 2.11. I don't think this is caused by this patch because this test passed all other recent tests. Thanks so much for taking time to review this patch!

@lindong28 Thanks for updating the patch. Merged to trunk.
@junrao @ijuma Thanks for the review!

org.apache.kafka.streams.integration.ResetIntegrationTest > testReprocessingFromScratchAfterResetWithoutIntermediateUserTopic STARTED seems to hang. This is consistent with what I see in trunk.
@ewencp We were setting retention.bytes=0 to force clearing up messages in topics. Now it is not an option anymore. Is there an api to achieve this goal?
